title: Lahat ng account
content:
1. Numbered list item

Lumaktaw sa pangunahing nilalaman Lumipat ng wika Laktawan upang maghanap


Isasara ng Mozilla ang mga serbisyo ng Pocket sa Hulyo 8, 2025. Sa panahong iyon, hindi na maa-access ng mga user ang Pocket website, apps at API. Maaari mong i-export ang iyong mga naka-save na item at data ng API hanggang Oktubre 8, 2025 bago sila permanenteng maalis. Para sa karagdagang impormasyon, tingnanang artikulong ito.

Logo ng Suporta ng Mozilla Maghanap Menu Avatar para sa Username Baguhin ang Produkto Galugarin ang Mga Solusyon Kumuha ng Suporta Iwasan ang mga panloloko sa suporta. Hindi namin kailanman hihilingin sa iyo na tumawag o mag-text sa isang numero ng telepono o magbahagi ng personal na impormasyon. Mangyaring mag-ulat ng kahina-hinalang aktibidad gamit ang opsyong "Mag-ulat ng Pang-aabuso."

Matuto pa

Logo ng Firefox Firefox Itanong mo Maging mabait. Ang aming mga boluntaryo ay mga gumagamit ng Mozilla tulad mo, na naglalaan ng oras sa kanilang araw upang tumulong.

Maging mapaglarawan. Ang pagsasabi na "palaging pabagu-bago ang pag-play ng video sa YouTube" ay makakatulong sa amin na maunawaan ang isyu kaysa sa pagsasabi ng "may mali" o "nasira ang app." Paksa: Lahat ng account Aling paksa ang pinakamahusay na naglalarawan sa iyong tanong?

Mga account Paano tayo makakatulong? Matapang Italic Maglagay ng link... Listahan ng Numero Bullet na Listahan


Magdagdag ng mga larawan (opsyonal): Mag-browse... No file chosen Nakagawa kami ng ilang edukadong hula tungkol sa iyong kasalukuyang browser at operating system. Itago ang mga detalye »

Bersyon ng Firefox (opsyonal): Operating system (opsyonal): Impormasyon sa Pag-troubleshoot (opsyonal):

Ibahagi ang Data Ang impormasyong ito ay nagbibigay ng mga detalye tungkol sa panloob na paggana ng iyong browser na makakatulong sa pagsagot sa iyong tanong.


I-email ako kapag may sumagot sa thread Nakatutulong na icon ng Tip Nakatutulong na Tip! Sundan. Minsan, hihingi sa iyo ang aming mga boluntaryo ng higit pang impormasyon o upang subukan ang ilang mga sitwasyon. Kung mas maaga mong magagawa ito, mas maaga nilang malalaman kung paano ito ayusin.


Isumite Kanselahin Mozilla Mag-ulat ng Pang-aabuso sa Trademark Source code Twitter Sumali sa aming Komunidad Galugarin ang Mga Artikulo ng Tulong Firefox I-download Firefox desktop Android Browser iOS Browser Focus Browser Firefox para sa Mga Nag-develop Edisyon ng Developer Beta Beta para sa Android Gabi-gabi Gabi-gabi para sa Android Mozilla Account Ano Ito? I-reset ang Password I-sync ang Iyong Data Humingi ng Tulong Wika Wika Ingles Twitter (@firefox) YouTube (firefoxchannel) Instagram (firefox) Mozilla mozilla.org Mga Tuntunin ng Serbisyo Pagkapribado Mga cookies Makipag-ugnayan Bisitahin ang hindi-for-profit na magulang ng Mozilla Corporation , ang Mozilla Foundation .

title: How to delete history
content:
How can I delete search history? I have a few misspelled searches and similar old stuff that pops up in the address bar when I type in a new search.

I have tried several things:

  • Settings → Privacy & Security → Clear data → Selecting and marking everything but with no effect whatsoever
  • Settings → Privacy & Security → History → Firefox will never remember history + Clear history as mentioned above
  • Settings → Search → Search suggestions → everything disabled
  • Settings → Search → Address bar → everything but Bookmarks have been disabled
  • Deleted my old Firefox account and created a new so I can still sync between 2 computers

Example: Previously I used www.adobe.com but now I use www.adobe.dk. But everytime I enter adobe in the address bar, Firefox keeps suggesting (autofill) adobe.com instead adobe.dk.

Any suggestions how to clear/delete the browser/search history so I can get a fresh start?

title: YouTube videos stutter or play choppily in Firefox
content:
Hi! I'm experiencing an issue where videos on YouTube stutter or play choppily when using Firefox. This happens even when the internet connection is strong and works fine in other browsers like Chrome.

Here’s what I’ve noticed:

The issue occurs on both 720p and 1080p videos.

It’s more noticeable when switching to full-screen mode.

I’ve tried disabling hardware acceleration, but it didn’t help.

Firefox is up to date (v126.0).

I’m using Windows 11 and have an NVIDIA GPU with the latest drivers.

I’d appreciate any suggestions or fixes. Thanks in advance for your help!
creator: hello.stratify

title: NVIDIA RTX Video Enhancements not working at all
content:
Hello,

NVIDIA RTX Video Enhancements are not working in firefox at all. By not working, i mean neither Super Resolution neither HDR enhancements work at all, not even the badge shows up, and the NVIDIA app reports the status as "inactive". The video is not upscaled, and the content isn't getting put into HDR. It is on globally on my system, and does work on all the chromium based browsers installed on my system, even on the discord app itself.

I tried a latest firefox fresh install, with youtube playback, or just opening a video file directly with the browser. This worked on chromium browsers, but not on firefox.

I'm on windows 10 64bit with a 3060 gpu. (the only gpu in the system.) I have 4 monitors connected, but still get the same issue with only one. Hardware decoding is force enabled, and about:support reports that hardware decoding is supported for H264, VP8, VP9 and AV1 too. I even get the same amount of video-decode usage in task manager on both chromium and firefox while video is playing.

Thanks in advance.

title: Websites say WebGL not supported by browser
content:
Anything using WebGL in-browser tells me that my browser doesn't support it.

https://get.webgl.org/ says "Hmm. While your browser seems to support WebGL, it is disabled or unavailable. If possible, please ensure that you are running the latest drivers for your video card." but I updated it to the most recent drivers and the issue is still happening. Graphics card is an AMD Radeon RX 6600 XT.
creator: jackdavidhaseldine

title: Some website scripts linger after the tab is closed
content:
After a recent update, certain websites (like Youtube) leak script that remains even after the tab is closed, until Firefox is closed. When one of these websites is accessed for the first time, a second tab opens and quickly closes, as if a popup was blocked. One way I can observe this behaviour is that the NoScript extension will detect script for that website on ALL tabs, even blank ones, with the "(sidebar?)" annotation. With Youtube I managed to prevent this by disabling Service Workers in about:config, but for example with tenor.com the behaviour continues to occur even then.

Websites I observed this behaviour on so far: youtube.com (until Service Workers were disabled) tenor.com nami.news

Is this a bug? I have also observed the same behaviour on a different PC for Youtube until I disabled Service Workers on that installation. What should I do?
creator: Clovers
